intro: Oxyanthus pyriformis subsp. tanganyikensis, commonly known as the Tanganyikan oxyanthus, is a flowering plant native to Tanzania. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers clustered in inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
